item.title: Carl Bean, singer of LGBT pride anthem I Was Born This Way, dies aged 77
item.description: Carl Bean was also a prominent Aids activist who founded a network of LGBT churches.

item.title: Married At First Sight UK's Nikita Jasmine removed for 'aggression'
item.description: Nikita Jasmine behaved in an "unacceptable" way on the matchmaking show, Channel 4 says.

item.title: The Wanted reunite for Tom Parker cancer charity gig
item.description: The group also announce a greatest hits album, including their first new music in seven years.

item.title: Nicole Scherzinger hits back at 'false' Pussycat Dolls reunion claims
item.description: The Pussycat Dolls star is being sued by the band's founder for refusing to join a reunion tour.

item.title: Rihanna drops legal case against her father
item.description: The singer had accused her father of misusing her name to further his entertainment business.

item.title: Edward Barnes: Tributes paid to Newsround creator
item.description: He said he got the idea for Newsround after realising few children watched the news.

item.title: Roy 'Chubby' Brown: Sheffield cancellation supported by council
item.description: Sheffield's council leader says the comedian's material "does not reflect" the city's values.

item.title: Ed Sheeran donates £10K to friend's hospice appeal
item.description: Ed Sheeran spent three years supporting Leamington Spa-based Nizlopi when he was a teenager.

item.title: Bugzy Malone punched man in face very hard, court hears
item.description: The rapper punched a stranger "very, very hard" leaving him with a broken jaw, a court hears.

item.title: Britney Spears' father formally files to end conservatorship
item.description: Jamie Spears files papers in an LA court to formally end the 13-year arrangement with the singer.

item.title: Ai Weiwei: Credit Suisse closed bank account over China
item.description: The Chinese artist says Credit Suisse closed his foundation's bank account over his "criminal record".

item.title: Only Fools and Horses: Archive found on 40th anniversary
item.description: Negatives from the classic sitcom found in the BBC Archives have been restored and digitised.

item.title: Spielberg and Hanks' WW2 drama transforms Hemel Hempstead
item.description: Filming for Masters of the Air takes place on a High Street which is turned into a 1940s set.

item.title: Baby Queen: Meet pop's boldest, sharpest new voice
item.description: "I have a problem releasing music that doesn't feel significant," says Bella Latham, aka Baby Queen.

item.title: Britney Spears: Singer's conservatorship case explained
item.description: The ongoing arrangement has sparked a public backlash from fans who support the #FreeBritney movement.

item.title: Sarah Harding: She was always going at 100mph
item.description: The team behind Girls Aloud's biggest hits remember Sarah Harding who's died at the age of 39.

item.title: The charm of French film great Jean-Paul Belmondo
item.description: Star of Breathless, Jean-Paul Belmondo was one of France's most popular actors.

item.title: 'An irrepressible and immensely likeable pop star'
item.description: The late singer was an irrepressible and immensely likeable pop star with a "wild child" reputation.

item.title: 'Abba saved 2021' - why the Swedish band have not gone out of fashion
item.description: Forty years after their last album, a new generation of fans is hungry for the pop legends' music.

item.title: Girls Aloud singer Sarah Harding - her life in pictures
item.description: From Popstars: The Rivals to chart-topping, award-winning success and a Celebrity Big Brother win.

item.title: Shang-Chi: Why the MCU's first Asian superhero is empowering change
item.description: Shang-Chi And The Legend Of The Ten Rings sees Simu Liu front an Asian-led cast. Why does it matter?

item.title: JLS comeback: 'The energy is still there'
item.description: The hit boy band tell Radio 1 Newsbeat why they're back after an eight-year break.

item.title: Sarah Harding dies: The Girls Aloud icon's life in video
item.description: The singer, who announced she had breast cancer in August 2020, has died at the age of 39.

item.title: Hilary Mantel compares Wolf Hall's Thomas Cromwell to modern political figures
item.description: Wolf Hall author Hilary Mantel says modern political figures don't match up to past ones.

item.title: Abba announce new album Voyage and virtual concerts in London
item.description: The Swedish group unveil their first new music in almost 40 years and shows in London from May 2022.

item.title: Piers Morgan speaks after Ofcom clears ITV over Meghan comments
item.description: Piers Morgan has spoken out after Ofcom cleared ITV over his criticism of Meghan Markle on Good Morning Britain.

item.title: Daniel Mays: Anthony Hopkins 'way off the mark' about drama schools
item.description: Actor Daniel Mays says he "wholeheartedly" disagrees with Anthony Hopkins’ views on drama schools.
